row.notes: Sadness哀 harming毀 one's body to the point they wither away to just a standing立 skeleton骨
row.jpn: 悲しみの極み。

row.notes: The Duke of Zhou (周公旦) was so passionate about hiring quality sages that he would welcome them in at any time, if he was washing his hair髪, he'd wring握 it dry, and if he was eating, he'd spit吐 out what he's chewing哺
row.jpn: 優れた人材を求めるのに熱心なこと。

row.notes: Wearing clothes衣 of brocade錦 and returning還 to your hometown郷
row.jpn: 立身出世して故郷に帰ること。

row.notes: 一行=singular focus; 三昧=focused buddhist training
row.jpn: 心を一つにして仏道修行に励むこと。

row.english: A once in a lifetime encounter
row.notes: One一 period期 of time, one一 encounter会; Originally referred to tea ceremony, where one was encouraged to give their absolute best each time. Nowadays, strongly associated with serendipity, chance encounters and meeting new people.
row.jpn: 生涯に一度だけ合うこと。また、生涯に一度限りであること。

row.notes: One一 look目 and its clear瞭, 然 often emphasizes meaning of previous kanji
row.jpn: ちょっと見ただけではっきりとわかること。

row.english: With all your might; With everything you got
row.notes: Originally, 一所懸命=a samurai staking懸 their life on protecting one一 place所; 所（しょ） extended becomes 生（しょう）
row.jpn: 命がけでものごとにあたること。いちずに苦心すること。

row.notes: Occurance一旦 of emergency緩急; Ex: 一旦緩急あれば…
row.jpn: ひとたび緊急の事態になったとき。いざという場合。

row.english: Starting over from scratch; Back to square one; Back to the drawing board
row.notes: With one一 stroke of the brush筆, pull勾 across the page and erase消 everything; Also 一筆勾銷
row.jpn: これまでの全てを取り消すこと。

row.notes: 鬱, commonly used for 'depression,' literally depicts overgrown vegetation. This can mean 'teeming with life and vitality' or 'dark and dank.' 勃勃 is full of energy.
row.jpn: 気が盛んに満ちるさま。

row.english: The highest form of contemplation in Buddhism
row.notes: Round円 and inter-inclusive頓 truth realized through calming止 meditation and clear sight観
row.jpn: 人格を完成した究極の境地をいう。

row.notes: Side横 brow眉 and angry怒 eyes目
row.syn: 横眉立目,張眉怒目,柳眉倒竪
row.jpn: 怒った顔つきのこと。

row.notes: The eyes目 watching from the sidelines岡 can see 8八 moves目 ahead. 目 refers to a "move" in Go.
row.jpn: はたで見ているほうが、当事者よりも情勢を正確に判断できること。

row.notes: Treat both those who give you hate怨 and those who give you kindness親 as equal平等
row.jpn: 怨み敵対する者も憎まず、親しい者でもえこひいきしない。

row.english: The stress of dealing with spiteful hate-filled people
row.notes: Suffering苦 caused by meeting会 with someone filled with spite怨 and hate憎
row.jpn: 怨み憎しみを抱く者と会わなければならない苦しみのこと。

row.notes: Hateful怨 enemy敵, disband退散! A Buddhist phrase for chasing away evil spirits.
row.jpn: 怨みに思っている敵よ、退散せよということ。

row.kun: 苛政(カセイ)は虎(とら)よりも猛(たけ)し
row.english: An oppressive government is more ferocious than a tiger
row.notes: An oppressive苛 government政 is more ferocious猛 than a tiger虎. From a story where Confucius finds a woman sobbing on the side of the road. She says her husband and child were eaten by a tiger. Confucius asks why she doesn't leave such a dangerous area, and she answers because there is no oppressive government controlling that area.
row.jpn: 民衆にとって過酷な政治は人食い虎よりももっと恐ろしいということ。

row.notes: Sweet甘 speech言, honeyed蜜 words語
row.jpn: 相手に取り入るための甘い言葉。

row.notes: Simple簡単 and clear明瞭
row.jpn: 簡単ではっきりとしていること。

row.kun: 棺(かん)を蓋(おお)いて事(こと)定(さだ)まる
row.notes: After the coffin棺 is covered蓋, things事 are settled定 regarding your reputation
row.jpn: 死んでからはじめて、その人物の評価が定まるということ

row.kun: 外(そと)は巧(たく)み、内(うち)では嫉(ねた)む
row.english: Pretending to be supportive, but are actually jealous
row.notes: On the outside外 you use skilled巧 language to feign support, but on the inside内 you're jealous嫉
row.jpn: うわべはとりつくろっているが、内心ではねたんでいること。

row.kun: 天を蓋(おお)い、地を蓋(おお)う
row.english: The teachings of Buddha reaching all ends of the Earth
row.notes: The teachings of Buddha covering蓋 the heavens天 and earth地
row.jpn: 仏の教えがすべての世界に、広くすみずみまでゆきわたること。

row.kun: 瓦(かわら)が解(と)け、土(つち)が崩(くず)れる
row.notes: Tiles瓦 split解 and earth土 crumbled崩
row.jpn: 物事が根底から崩れ、もはや手のほどこしようもない状態のこと。

row.notes: A tile瓦 chicken鶏 and clay陶 dog犬. The form looks good, but they can't lay eggs or catch prey. Usu 陶犬瓦鶏
row.jpn: 格好ばかりで役に立たないもののたとえ。

row.kun: 牙(きば)を含(ふく)み、角(つの)を戴(いただ)く
row.notes: Fangs牙 [in mouth>含 and horn角 [upon head>戴
row.jpn: 牙や角をもつもの。

row.kun: 人(ひと)を玩(もてあそ)べば、徳(とく)を喪(うしな)う
row.english: Look down upon others and lower your own status
row.notes: Treat people人 trivially玩 and lose喪 virtue徳
row.jpn: 人を軽くみてあなどると、自分の徳を失うことになるということ。

row.kun: 物(もの)を玩(もてあそ)べば、志(こころざし)を喪(うしな)う
row.english: Wasting time with frivolous activities and neglecting important work
row.notes: Playing玩 with things物 and losing喪 your ambition志
row.jpn: 無用なものに熱中して、本業がおろそかになること。

row.english: People enjoying a blessed and peaceful life
row.notes: Eating含 food哺 and pounding your stomach腹 like a drum鼓
row.jpn: 人々が豊かで平和な世を楽しむこと。

row.notes: Refers to a artistic technique that is overly indulgent
row.jpn: 快楽のみを求めた好ましくないもののたとえ。

row.reading: きっこうじゅうこつ, きこうじゅうこつ
row.notes: Turtle亀 shells甲 and beast獣 bones骨. The earliest known medium for carving kanji characters in ancient China.
row.jpn: 亀の甲羅と、けものの骨。

row.kun: 案(アン)を挙(あ)ぐること眉(まゆ)に斉(ひと)しくす
row.english: A married couple attentive to manners and etiquette
row.notes: Raising挙 the [meal setting>案 to be even斉 with the eyebrows眉 when presenting it
row.jpn: 夫婦の間に礼儀がいきとどいていること。

row.notes: Brocade錦 clothing衣 and jeweled玉 meals食
row.jpn: ぜいたくな生活をすること。

row.notes: Adding添 flowers花 upon上 brocade錦
row.jpn: よいもの美しいものの上にさらによいもの美しいものを加えること。

row.english: Better an honorable death than a meaningless life
row.notes: 玉砕 is a jewel玉 shattering砕 and refers to one of great honor dying for a noble cause. 瓦全 is someone living like a total全 [roofing tile>瓦, i.e., just sitting around doing nothing.
row.jpn: 名誉を重んじて死ぬことと何をなすこともなく生きながらえること。

row.english: Composing poetry about the beauty of nature
row.notes: Singing吟 praises of the wind風, enjoying弄 the moon月
row.jpn: 詩人が自然の景色を題材に即興詩を作ること。

row.english: The joy and pain of living
row.notes: In trying苦 times, your hair髪 grows. In joyful楽 times, your nails爪 grow. Usu 苦爪楽髪
row.jpn: 人の世の苦楽のようす。

row.english: The joy and pain of living
row.notes: In trying苦 times, your nails爪 grow. In joyful楽 times, your hair髪 grows.
row.jpn: 人の世の苦楽のようす。

row.english: Three things before which the purposed man stands in awe
row.notes: The ordinances of heaven, great men and the words of sages
row.jpn: 君子のおそれ慎むべき三つのこと。

row.english: Two people hitting it off like they're old friends
row.notes: Leaning傾 the roofs蓋 of your carts together to chat like I know知 you己 well
row.jpn: ちょっと語り合っただけなのに古くからの友人のようにうちとけて親しくなるたとえ。

row.english: Complicated national borders between two countries
row.notes: National borders that like a dog's犬 teeth牙, restrain制 [each other>相
row.jpn: 国境が入りくんでいて、たがいに牽制しあうこと。

row.notes: 堅 and 固 both mean hard and solid. 塞 and 塁 both mean fort.
row.jpn: 非常に堅固なとりで。

row.notes: Hoist懸 your head頭 and stab刺 your thigh股. The study practices of Sun Jing (孫敬) and Su Qin (蘇秦). Jing would hang a rope from the rafters to hold his head upright, while Qin would stab his thigh with a gimlet to stay awake.
row.syn: 懸頭錐股,懸梁刺股,懸梁錐股,刺股読書,蛍窓雪案,蛍雪之功
row.jpn: 苦学のたとえ。

row.notes: Smart賢 and bright明, stupid愚 and dark昧
row.jpn: かしこいことと、愚かで道理にくらいこと。

row.kun: 後生(コウセイ)、畏(おそ)る可(べ)し
row.english: The up-and-coming generation holds great promise
row.notes: The succeeding後 generation生 should可 be viewed with reverence畏 for their sheer potential
row.jpn: 年少者は、大きな可能性を秘め、将来どんな力量をあらわすかわからないのでおそれ敬うべきである。

row.kun: 天(テン)に向(む)かって唾(つば)を吐(は)く
row.notes: Facing向 the heavens天 and hawking吐 spit唾. It just falls back down on your face.
row.jpn: 人に害を加えようとして、逆に自分がその害を受けることになること。

row.notes: 荒唐 is literally a large area of arid land, i.e., devoid of substance. 無稽 is lacking any basis for thought.
row.jpn: 言説に根拠がなく、現実性に欠けること。でたらめ。

row.english: ① Engulfed in mist ② A bad omen
row.notes: Yellow黄 mist霧 in four四 (all) directions enclosing塞
row.jpn: 黄色のきりが四方に満ち満ちる。天下の乱れる兆し。

row.notes: Unyielding克 stubborness, hubris伐, rancor怨, desire欲
row.jpn: 勝ち気・自ら誇る・うらむ・むさぼるの四つの悪心のこと。

row.english: Time flies when you're having fun
row.notes: In tiger虎 valley渓 three三 men laugh笑. 'Tiger Valley' is a valley near Mt. Lu (盧山). Huiyuan (慧遠) was a monk who had lived at a mountain temple his whole life and never crossed Tiger Valley. One day, a poet, Tao Qian (陶潜), and a Taoist, Lu Xiujing (陸修静) came to visit. The three hit it off well, and so, when it was time to depart, Huiyuan led the two men down the mountain to see them off. However, Huiyuan was so engrossed in their lively conversation, he didn't even notice he was heading straight across Tiger Valley. It wasn't until a tiger's roar echoed across the valley that the men suddenly snapped out of it, realized how far they'd come, and shared a hearty laugh.
row.jpn: あることに熱中するあまり、他のことをすべて忘れてしまうこと。

row.notes: If you don't enter the tiger虎 den穴, you can't get a tiger虎 cub子
row.jpn: 危険を冒さなければ功名は立てられないということ。

row.notes: A prideful誇大 delusion妄想
row.jpn: 自分の現状を実際以上に想像して事実のように思いこむこと。

row.english: An exciting start but disappointing finish
row.notes: Begins with tiger虎 head頭, ends with snake蛇 tail尾
row.jpn: 初めは盛んで、終わりがふるわないたとえ

row.notes: A tiger虎 tail尾 (don't step on it!) or springtime春 ice氷 (quickly melts away)
row.jpn: きわめて危険なことのたとえ。

row.english: ① The absolute limits ② Absolutely, definitely
row.notes: In Buddhist terminology, 金輪 is the lowest level of the Earth and 奈落 is a the depths of Hell.
row.jpn: 物事の極限のこと。

row.notes: 傲岸 is being haughty and looking down on others. 不遜 is showing no humility.
row.jpn: 思いあがって、人に従おうとしないさま。

row.english: ① Stuck in the same boat ② Forced to make a temporary truce with an enemy
row.notes: During the Spring and Autumn Period in China, the nations of Wu呉 and Yue越 were bitter rivals that fought endlessly. However, it is said that one day a citizen of Wu and Yue were on the same同 boat舟 crossing a river and encountered fierce winds. They put aside their differences and worked together to make it through.
row.jpn: 仲の悪い者どうしが、同じ場所や境遇にいること。

row.english: Joy and sorrow and today and tomorrow; What will be, will be
row.notes: From a story involving an [old man>翁 living at a fort塞 in Northern China who loses失 his horse馬. One day, the horse runs away, but then it returns some time later with a second horse of great strength and speed. However, the man's son rides the new horse and falls off and breaks his leg. Then, when the man's territory is invaded, many young men are called to serve and die in battle. However, since his son suffers from a broken leg, he is not required to fight and ends up living a long life.
row.jpn: 人生の幸不幸は予測できないので、いたずらに一喜一憂すべきではないということ。

row.notes: Relatives親戚 on the left左 (a position indicating lower status), and sages賢 on the right右 (a position indicating higher status). A practice during the Han漢 dynasty.
row.jpn: 親戚の者を低い地位「左」におき、賢者を高い地位「右」におくこと。

row.notes: Discussion偶語 in中 the sand砂. Refers to one of Liu Bang's (劉邦) retainers, who after demotion, discussed rebellion with others.
row.jpn: 臣下が謀反の相談をすること。

row.reading: さらそうじゅ, しゃらそうじゅ
row.english: The twin trees that saw Śākyamuni into nirvana
row.notes: Four [Shala trees>沙羅 were present at the death of Śākyamuni, but two withered in grief, so only a pair双 of trees樹 remained
row.jpn: 釈迦が涅槃に入ったとき、その四方に二本ずつあったという娑羅の木。

row.english: A lie told enough times becomes the truth
row.notes: Three三 people人 create成 a tiger虎. If three people claim there is a tiger in the city, it becomes de facto reality. From the Warring States period. A metaphor used by Pang Kong (龐蔥) of Wei魏 to illustrate the power of rumors.
row.jpn: 真実でないことも、多くの人が言うといつのまにか真実であるかのようになってしまうたとえ。

row.notes: Three三 flats平 (forehead, nose and lower jaw), two二 filled満 out areas (fat cheeks).
row.jpn: じゅうぶんではないが、心がやすらかで満足していること。

row.english: Cutting edge, never-before-seen, fresh and new
row.notes: (NULL)
row.jpn: 物事の着想が独特で、これまでにない新しさを兼ね備えていること。

row.notes: 歯牙 is teeth and fangs, representing the opening of the mouth. 余論 is excess argument, or something you can't keep in and have to let out. Stems from a phrase saying one should not hesitate to speak encouragement or praise, even if just a word or two.
row.jpn: わずかな言葉。

row.english: A lie told enough times becomes the truth
row.notes: Three三 tell伝 of a tiger虎 in the city市. If three people claim there is a tiger in the city, it becomes de facto reality. From the Warring States period. A metaphor used by Pang Kong (龐蔥) of Wei魏 to illustrate the power of rumors.
row.jpn: 真実でないことも、多くの人が言うといつのまにか真実であるかのようになってしまうたとえ。

row.notes: One who's beauty makes the flowers花 embarrassed羞 and the moon月 hide閉 in shame; Also 羞月閉花
row.jpn: 美しい女性のこと。

row.notes: One who's beauty makes the shames羞 the moon月 and closes閉 flowers花 in reverence.
row.jpn: 美しい女性のこと。

row.notes: The masses衆 are drunk酔 and you alone独 are sober覚.
row.jpn: 周囲の人はみな道をはずれており、自分だけが正しいということ。

row.english: Harsh or severe punishment, authority or intensely dominating will
row.notes: Harsh as the cold autumn秋 frost霜 or intense烈 summer sun日
row.jpn: 刑罰・権威・意志などがきわめて厳しいたとえ。

row.notes: Not the trunk, but the branches枝, leaves葉 and tips末節
row.jpn: 本質からはずれた些細なこと

row.notes: 森羅=Flora spread like a blanket across the Earth; 万象=Many things of all shapes and sizes
row.jpn: 宇宙に存在するすべてのもの。

row.english: Something or someone you can always depend on
row.notes: Something in your自 home's家 medicine薬 basket籠 (yours to use freely)
row.jpn: いつでも役に立てられるもの。わが手中のもの。

row.notes: 熟読 is to read over very carefully. 玩味 is to taste slowly in your mouth, i.e., enjoy thoroughly.
row.jpn: 文章の意味をじっくり考えて読み味わうこと。

row.notes: 泰然・自若 both mean relaxed/calm
row.jpn: 何か事が起こっても、落ち着きはらって少しも動じないさま。

row.notes: Going through徹 from head頭 to tail尾
row.jpn: 最初から最後まで。

row.notes: A clay陶 dog犬 and tile瓦 chicken鶏. The form looks good, but they can't catch prey or lay eggs.
row.jpn: 格好ばかりで役に立たないもののたとえ。

row.notes: Running奔 East東, running走 West西
row.jpn: 仕事や用事のため四方八方忙しく走りまわること。

row.notes: The Duke of Zhou (周公旦) was so passionate about hiring quality sages that he would welcome them in at any time, if he was washing his hair髪, he'd wring握 it, and if he was eating, he'd spit吐 out what he's chewing哺
row.jpn: すぐれた人材を求めるのに熱心なこと。

row.notes: The Duke of Zhou (周公旦) was so passionate about hiring quality sages that he would welcome them in at any time, if he was washing his hair髪, he'd wring握 it, and if he was eating, he'd spit吐 out what he's chewing哺
row.jpn: すぐれた人材を求めるのに熱心なこと

row.kun: 土(つち)が崩(くず)れ、瓦(かわら)が解(と)ける
row.notes: Earth土 crumbled崩 and tiles瓦 split解
row.jpn: 物事が根底から崩れ、もはや手のほどこしょうもない状態のこと。

row.notes: Internal内 worry憂, external外 woe患
row.jpn: 内部にも外にも問題が多く、心配事が多いこと。

row.notes: Polished錬磨 through 100百 battles戦
row.jpn: 多くの経験をふんで鍛えられていること。

row.notes: 付和=being agreeable; 雷同=echoing thunder, i.e., matching whatever your boss says; Also 附和雷同
row.jpn: 自分の主義主張がなく、他人の言動に軽々しく同調すること。

row.notes: A three三-day日 monk坊主
row.jpn: 何をしても飽きっぽくて長続きしないこと。

row.notes: 悠悠=calm, leisurely; 自適=suited to your tastes
row.jpn: ゆったりとした気持ちでのんびり過ごすこと。
